title: Higher Education and Regional Transformation: Social and Cultural Perspectives (The Heart Project)
abstractText:
This project explores the impacts of universities on the social and cultural lives of the communities of which they are a part, including the impact on social cohesion and inclusion, on citizenship and on the alleviation of various forms of social disadvantage. 

The central question of the research is:

To what extent and in what ways do universities benefit or further disadvantage members of socially disadvantaged groups within their regional contexts?

In particular, the project aims to advance understanding of the role played by universities in:

  • Helping to build new or strengthen existing institutions of civil society
  • Encouraging and facilitating new cultural values and social cohesion
  • Extending social and economic opportunities
  • Selecting and socialising new leaders
  • Generating new possibilities for relationships between local, national and global trends.

The project is adopting a case study approach and will focus on four universities/regions.

  • Stage I will focus on one university/region. It will collect information from staff and students within the university and from regional actors and residents using a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods.
  • Stage II will apply the methods tested out in Stage I to a further three case study universities/regions.
